        public Elastic_RForecast(java.lang.String es_host,
                         int es_port,
                         java.lang.String es_path,

                         java.lang.String es_pwd,
                         java.lang.String Rfunctions_path)
                  throws org.rosuda.REngine.REngineException,
                         org.rosuda.REngine.REXPMismatchException
        Connects with RServe and sources the script's functions to R
        Parameters:
        es_host: - IP or domain name of the elasticsearch instance containing the data
        es_port: - Port of the elasticsearch instance containing the data
        es_path: - (Optional, "" if there is no path) Path to the elasticsearch instance
        es_user: - (to use if the elasticsearch is protected with basic auth.) Username to access the elasticsearch instance
        es_pwd: - (to use if the elasticsearch is protected with basic auth.) Password to access the elasticsearch instance
        Rfunctions_path: - (On Rserve side) Path to the R scripts' file
        Throws:
        org.rosuda.REngine.REngineException
        org.rosuda.REngine.REXPMismatchException

        Parameters:
        es_host: - IP or domain name of the elasticsearch instance containing the data
        es_port: - Port of the elasticsearch instance containing the data
        es_path: - (Optional, "" if there is no path) Path to the elasticsearch instance
        es_user: - (to use if the elasticsearch is protected with basic auth.) Username to access the elasticsearch instance
        es_pwd: - (to use if the elasticsearch is protected with basic auth.) Password to access the elasticsearch instance
        rserve_host: - IP or domain name of RServe. Default is localhost
        rserve_port: - Port to use to access RServe. Default is 6311
        Rfunctions_path: - (On Rserve side) Path to the R scripts' file

    • Method Detail

      • close

        public void close()
        Closes the connection to RServe

      • multipleElementTrain

        public void multipleElementTrain(java.lang.String[] elementNames,
                                 java.lang.String index,
                                 java.lang.String tsFrequency,
                                 Common.ForecastTechnique technique)
                          throws org.rosuda.REngine.REXPMismatchException,
                                 org.rosuda.REngine.REngineException
        Fits multiple forecast models using a single forecasting technique and saves them to disk. This function should be called periodically in order to keep the saved models up-to-date with recent data.
        Parameters:
        elementNames: - array containing the elements for which the forecasting models will be fitted
        index: - elasticsearch index containing the elements of "elementNames" array
        tsFrequency: - The value of argument frequency is used when the series is sampled an integral number of times in each unit time interval. For example, one could use a value of 7 for frequency when the data are sampled daily, and the natural time period is a week, or 12 when the data are sampled monthly and the natural time period is a year. Values of 4 and 12 are assumed in (e.g.) print methods to imply a quarterly and monthly series respectively. Source: "ts" R documentation
        technique: - Technique to be used to fit the forecasting model. To be defined using the enum "Common.ForecastTechnique"
        Throws:
        org.rosuda.REngine.REXPMismatchException
        org.rosuda.REngine.REngineException

      • multipleElementForecast

        public java.util.ArrayList<ForecastDTO> multipleElementForecast(java.lang.String[] elementNames,
                                                                java.lang.String index,
                                                                java.lang.String tsFrequency,
                                                                java.lang.String horizon,
                                                                Common.ForecastTechnique technique)
                                                         throws org.rosuda.REngine.REXPMismatchException,
                                                                org.rosuda.REngine.REngineException
        Forecasts multiple models using a single forecasting technique. For every element, the method will check if there exists a saved fitted model with the chosed technique. If it's found, it will be loaded and used to perform the forecast. If not, the model will be fitted and saved to disk prior to the forecasting.
        Parameters:
        elementNames: - array containing the elements for which the forecasting models will be fitted
        index: - elasticsearch index containing the elements of "elementNames" array
        tsFrequency: - The value of argument frequency is used when the series is sampled an integral number of times in each unit time interval. For example, one could use a value of 7 for frequency when the data are sampled daily, and the natural time period is a week, or 12 when the data are sampled monthly and the natural time period is a year. Values of 4 and 12 are assumed in (e.g.) print methods to imply a quarterly and monthly series respectively. Source: "ts" R documentation
        horizon: - Number of periods to forecast. If working with daily data, it will correspond to the number of days to forecast
        technique: - Technique to be used to fit the forecasting model. To be defined using the enum "Common.ForecastTechnique"
        Throws:
        org.rosuda.REngine.REXPMismatchException
        org.rosuda.REngine.REngineException

      • trainForecastModel

        public void trainForecastModel(java.lang.String elementName,
                               java.lang.String index,
                               java.lang.String tsFrequency,
                               Common.ForecastTechnique technique)
                        throws org.rosuda.REngine.REXPMismatchException,
                               org.rosuda.REngine.REngineException
        Fits an individual forecasting model using the selected forecasting technique and saves the model to disk. This function should be called periodically in order to keep the saved model up-to-date with recent data.
        Parameters:
        elementName: - Element for which the forecasting model will be fitted
        index: - elasticsearch index containing the element to forecast ("elementName")
        tsFrequency: - The value of argument frequency is used when the series is sampled an integral number of times in each unit time interval. For example, one could use a value of 7 for frequency when the data are sampled daily, and the natural time period is a week, or 12 when the data are sampled monthly and the natural time period is a year. Values of 4 and 12 are assumed in (e.g.) print methods to imply a quarterly and monthly series respectively. Source: "ts" R documentation
        technique: - Technique to be used to fit the forecasting model. To be defined using the enum "Common.ForecastTechnique"
        Throws:
        org.rosuda.REngine.REXPMismatchException
        org.rosuda.REngine.REngineException

      • forecast

        public ForecastDTO forecast(java.lang.String elementName,
                            java.lang.String index,
                            java.lang.String tsFrequency,
                            java.lang.String horizon,
                            Common.ForecastTechnique technique)
                     throws org.rosuda.REngine.REXPMismatchException,
                            org.rosuda.REngine.REngineException
        Forecasts using the selected forecasting technique. The method will check if there exists a saved fitted model with the chosed technique. If it's found, it will be loaded and used to perform the forecast. If not, the model will be fitted and saved to disk prior to the forecasting.
        Parameters:
        elementName: - Element for which the forecasting model will be fitted
        index: - elasticsearch index containing the element to forecast ("elementName")
        tsFrequency: - The value of argument frequency is used when the series is sampled an integral number of times in each unit time interval. For example, one could use a value of 7 for frequency when the data are sampled daily, and the natural time period is a week, or 12 when the data are sampled monthly and the natural time period is a year. Values of 4 and 12 are assumed in (e.g.) print methods to imply a quarterly and monthly series respectively. Source: "ts" R documentation
        horizon: - Number of periods to forecast. If working with daily data, it will correspond to the number of days to forecast
        technique: - Technique to be used to fit the forecasting model. To be defined using the enum "Common.ForecastTechnique"
        Throws:
        org.rosuda.REngine.REXPMismatchException
        org.rosuda.REngine.REngineException
